column1: 0.0 Yeah, I have more years left.
column2: 1.0 That's awesome, you'll thank yourself later down the road for making yourself do it!

column1: 0.0 I caught somebody stealing a package from my front yard on surveillance.
column2: 1.0 Oh wow! I have heard of that happening to lots of people. Did they get arrested?

column1: 0.0 Not yet. People these days just don't care. They steal anything they lay their eyes on!
column2: 1.0 Yes they do. It has gotten really bad around here with car thefts. It's no wonder are car insurance rates are so high.

column1: 0.0 I just got back from buying a few groceries at the store.
column2: 1.0 Oh really? What'd ya get?

column1: 0.0 Just stuff for dinner. At the checkout, a guy took my receipt!
column2: 1.0 Why did he do that?

column1: 0.0 I studied really hard for my math test last week, so I knew I would ace it.
column2: 1.0 Math is a tough subject. Good for you.

column1: 0.0 I know, I feel like I can solve math problems that even Einstein couldn't solve.
column2: 1.0 Being good at math will open lots of opportunities for you. Keep at it.

column1: 0.0 We have taken many unplanned trips this summer that I didn't have money for. But I was able to pick up more work and pay for them.
column2: 1.0 How exciting that you were able to do that. I hope it was fun.

column1: 0.0 It has been a fun summer! I am so tired though.
column2: 1.0 It's funny how you need a vacation to recover from vacation.

column1: 0.0 I had a major project and felt very ready to present it to everyone at the office
column2: 1.0 How'd it go

column1: 0.0 It went well, I think I gained confidence by being so prepared
column2: 1.0 That's great. Do you present often?

column1: 0.0 I was walking home late at night and noticed I was being followed
column2: 1.0 Oh no, what happened?

column1: 0.0 I ended up running back to my place
column2: 1.0 Glad you are safe!

column1: 0.0 My girlfriend seems to be distant and talking to other guys
column2: 1.0 Have you talked to her about it?

column1: 0.0 Not yet, she's also been texting other guys as well I think
column2: 1.0 That doesn't sound too good. Has she been like this before?

column1: 0.0 I finished a team based project with some co-workers
column2: 1.0 Was it fun? Interesting? Engaging?

column1: 0.0 Yeah, it was fun, and we did so well
column2: 1.0 Good! Team based projects can be very hit or miss depending on your team so I'm glad it worked out for you

column1: 0.0 My girlfriend broke up with me
column2: 1.0 Did she give you a reason?

column1: 0.0 She fell out of love with me
column2: 1.0 Sorry to hear that, i hope you find somebody else in your life.

column1: 0.0 I left my wallet behind by accident
column2: 1.0 Sorry to hear that.Did you lose money?

column1: 0.0 I left in the bathroom and was able to get it back
column2: 1.0 So, you never actually lost the wallet.

column1: 0.0 A friend threw a birthday party for me
column2: 1.0 That sounds amazing! How did it go?

column1: 0.0 It was a lot of fun, I had no idea he was planning it
column2: 1.0 That's amazing, I have only had one brithday party like that in my life.

column1: 0.0 I found some old toys of mine
column2: 1.0 What kind?

column1: 0.0 Some action figures I had when I was younger, I felt pretty nostalgic
column2: 1.0 I use to have a G.I Joe.

column1: 0.0 A friend of mine was sick
column2: 1.0 What were they sick from?

column1: 0.0 Flu, I went over and gave him some food and medicine
column2: 1.0 That was nice of you.

column1: 0.0 A friend who I hadn't seen in awhile showed up at my door
column2: 1.0 I'll bet you were surprised. Were you glad to see them?

column1: 0.0 I was very happy to see him, we ended up going out for drinks
column2: 1.0 Did you reconnect and promise to keep in touch?

column1: 0.0 I met a girl I hadn't seen in some tme
column2: 1.0 Was she your girlfriend?

column1: 0.0 No, but we did end up going out on a date
column2: 1.0 That is great, did you have fun?

column1: 0.0 I really hated it when my dog got into the trash. It spilled everywhere.
column2: 1.0 Yeah, thats rough. I hate having to clean up mess that wasn't my fault.

column1: 0.0 Yeah, it was pretty gross. A lot of rotten food.
column2: 1.0 Yeah, that sounds annoying. Maybe try to scold the dog so they won't do it again?

column1: 0.0 I really miss my dog. We had to put her down.
column2: 1.0 That sucks. What was his name?

column1: 0.0 Barney. He was such a good boy.
column2: 1.0 Barney was the name of my hamster.

column1: 0.0 I was very anxious to start driving at 16.
column2: 1.0 I know that feeling. It's nerve racking trying to incorporate everything you learned at the DMV in real time.

column1: 0.0 It really is. It's like I can't remember all the rules of the road.
column2: 1.0 It's also scary thinking about getting in a car accident the whole time, that would definitely get me nervous.

column1: 0.0 I cannot wait to see Taylor Swift in concert!
column2: 1.0 My wife, LOVES taylor swift.

column1: 0.0 I actually went to high school with her. I cannot believe she is as famous as she is.
column2: 1.0 That is awesome, I went to high school with Brett Favre! Small world.

column1: 0.0 A female coworker came onto me at work the other day, but I refused her advances because I love my wife.
column2: 1.0 I am glad you love her, it must be a nice feeling

column1: 0.0 Yes, I just can't see myself being with another woman.
column2: 1.0 That is a good thing then

column1: 0.0 I cant believe I got arrested for a DUI this weekend, I let myself down.
column2: 1.0 That wasn't smart.

column1: 0.0 I know I promised myself I wasn't going to drink anymore.
column2: 1.0 Why did you then?

column1: 0.0 I feel good about my last semester. I think I'll do better in my engineering classes this fall.
column2: 1.0 Dang.. my old roommate was an engineering student. He always told me how hard it was. What kind of engineering?

column1: 0.0 I'm doing mechanical, it's pretty hard but it's interesting. A career in the field would be awesome!
column2: 1.0 Yeah, I think once you get in the field, you're set. The jobs seem to pay well. Good luck with that, you sound like you know what you're doing.

column1: 0.0 I hate taking the but, today I was late to my stop and got there just as it drove away....
column2: 1.0 Oh, the bus? Yeah I bet that was a little embarrassing. Sorry to hear that. I take my car for granted. Maybe you will get one someday.

column1: 0.0 I drove my parents' old car for a little, and i definitely took that for granted until it broke down lol. I'm trying to save up, I hope I get one too.
column2: 1.0 Well, keep working at it. It's a process.

column1: 0.0 I can't wait until I see my golden retriever Blue this weekend!
column2: 1.0 Where has he been?

column1: 0.0 I live away from my parents, he lives with them.
column2: 1.0 Oh I bet you are excited then! He will be happy too!

column1: 0.0 I saw a colleague stealing money at work. I wonder if I did the right thing by not telling my boss.
column2: 1.0 Is there a reason why you didn't tell your boss?

column1: 0.0 I just didn't want to be labeled as a snitch, but now I'm having second thoughts.
column2: 1.0 Is there a way you could report it anonymously?

column1: 0.0 I hate when it rains, especially for several days at a time.
column2: 1.0 Oh I do too! I like a nice sunny day.

column1: 0.0 How has the weather been where you are.
column2: 1.0 It's been really rainy. My power just went out awhile ago.

column1: 0.0 Oh no, does that happen a lot when it rains near you?
column2: 1.0 Yes it makes me pretty upset to be honest.

column1: 0.0 I remember when we used to compete with Yo-Yo's to see who could do the best tricks.
column2: 1.0 My brother used to have a yo-yo! He did a trick called "Around the world" and also one called "The cradle." Know those?

column1: 0.0 Yes, my favorite was called "Walk the dog".
column2: 1.0 Oh yeah! I remember that! I wasn't good at doing any of them. I mostly just watched him. Good memories.

column1: 0.0 Last week we were at an amusement park and I cant believe my little brother got on the roller coaster with us. He's usually afraid of heights.
column2: 1.0 Oh man I would have terrified I hate being up so high. He sounds really brave!

column1: 0.0 I know, he usually never goes on dangerous rides.
column2: 1.0 Did he go on anymore after that?

column1: 0.0 My son got spaghetti all over himself at dinner at a restaurant one night.
column2: 1.0 Well he's young, so you can't really fault him.

column1: 0.0 I didn't really care too much. I had remembered to pack him an extra set of clothes though.
column2: 1.0 That's good. You seem like a great parent.

column1: 0.0 I hate when it is storming it makes me so uncomfortable.
column2: 1.0 does it happen often in your part of the country?

column1: 0.0 Yes especially in the summer time storms are bad and hurricanes are at a high I hide under my covers lol.
column2: 1.0 wow.  i can only imagine

column1: 0.0 I was using the toilet at Walmart yesterday and somebody walked in on me.
column2: 1.0 Thats nuts.

column1: 0.0 Whats worse is that I was in the wrong restroom. It was the girls restroom. I just wanted to get out of there as fast as I could.
column2: 1.0 Did she scream?

column1: 0.0 I was finally going to get to see dolphins up close.
column2: 1.0 Did you get to? What happened?

column1: 0.0 I went to Sea World for the very first time. We got to feed the dolphins.
column2: 1.0 I have never been there! Sounds fun, but I don't support Sea World and the way they treat their animals.

column1: 0.0 Last week there was a huge tarantula on my wall. I thought it was going to jump on me.
column2: 1.0 OH GOSH! I would burn the whole house down. i'm terrified of spiders and bugs

column1: 0.0 OMG me too! I hit it with a rolled up news paper and a bunch of baby spiders came out. I had a panic attack and stomped on them.
column2: 1.0 i would have a heart attack!

column1: 0.0 I will never forget the first time I felt old. I saw a video of grandparents playing with grandchildren and I realized it had been awhile since I did those things.
column2: 1.0 I know how you feel. Life is too short.

column1: 0.0 yes, I try to remind myself that I still have a lot to offer.
column2: 1.0 Yes, you do! Just keep living everyday like your last.

column1: 0.0 Yesterday we had a pool party. My brother got drunk and did a back flip off the roof and landed in the pool.
column2: 1.0 wow, I never did understand why people want to get drunk in the first place. I sure hope he wasn't hurt.

column1: 0.0 I wasn't mad at him. I just never knew he was that athletic.
column2: 1.0 it does sound like an amzing feat

column1: 0.0 I got on social media yesterday and saw that my friends went to a party, but they didn't invite me.
column2: 1.0 ohh that's rough...did you talk to them about it

column1: 0.0 No, sometimes I feel like they just don't understand me.
column2: 1.0 do they give you any kind of value...or do they just ignore you / put you down 90% of the time?

column1: 0.0 Awhile back I was taking a relative to get a heart cath. The surgeon sent for me to enter the operating room.
column2: 1.0 Is your relative okay now?

column1: 0.0 oh yes, thank you for asking. other family members just got a call and told them everything went ok. Kind of scary when I was sent for.
column2: 1.0 It must've have been. Glad they are okay now.

column1: 0.0 I got teary eyed when I watched my little brother get his diploma at graduation.
column2: 1.0 Congratulations to him! You must be proud.

column1: 0.0 I am, every time he succeeds, I succeed. I love my big headed brother.
column2: 1.0 He's very lucky to have you.

column1: 0.0 I was supposed to drive a friend to work
column2: 1.0 oh yeah what happened?

column1: 0.0 I forgot to pick him up as I overslept
column2: 1.0 omg is he upset?

column1: 0.0 A friend needed help moving
column2: 1.0 So did you help him / her

column1: 0.0 Yeah, he didn't know of anyone else to turn to for help so I gave him a hand
column2: 1.0 That's pretty nice of you

column1: 0.0 Yesterday my friend bought the Ferrari I always wanted. I deserve it more than him.
column2: 1.0 Wow, thats a nice car

column1: 0.0 Yes, I don't know how a clown like him ended up with one before I did.
column2: 1.0 It happens sometimes I guess

column1: 0.0 I was thinking about my old neighborhood
column2: 1.0 Memories.. what state?

column1: 0.0 Can't say, but I was mostly just thinking about the friends I had there growing up
column2: 1.0 I understand but memories are always nice.

column1: 0.0 I needed to use my car to drive somewhere, but couldn't
column2: 1.0 What happened with your car then?

column1: 0.0 My car was hit while parked
column2: 1.0 Ugh! that stinks! Did you found out who did it?

column1: 0.0 I was at a Journey concert with my son and he had to go to the bathroom while they were switching out performers.
column2: 1.0 I would love that show

column1: 0.0 It was a very good show, but the people were so rude. We had to squeeze through a crazy crowd and didn't make it to the bathroom in time.
column2: 1.0 Oh well, it happens

column1: 0.0 i am suffering from severe fever for the past two days i don't have any energy
column2: 1.0 Have you been to the doctor?

column1: 0.0 yes i had. he prescribed medicine for curing
column2: 1.0 You will be fine then

column1: 0.0 Sometimes I'm surprised my son is actually my son. He currently has enough merit aid to pay for 2/3 of his college tuition!
column2: 1.0 Well that is quite the accomplishment.

column1: 0.0 It is certainly much better than I was ever able to do.  I think my scholarship was $500 and I had no merit aide.  He set his academic bar high... I just told him to do his best.
column2: 1.0 He sounds like he has a great head on his shoulder. You must have taught him well.

column1: 0.0 I now have a new boss, and today was my first day of a leadership meeting with him.  You never know how you will be received.
column2: 1.0 Oh man, that's so nerve-wracking. Do you think you guys will be a good fit?

column1: 0.0 He spent some time laying out his beliefs and his expectations, and I have to say, I agreed with all but one of them.  That's pretty good.  He spent a lot of time watching the rest of us interact with each other, so I think he is trying to feel us out without making judgments yet.
column2: 1.0 Then it sounds like at least he has some perspective and ability to know not to overreact. I guess you could say you lucked out, but that may be me speaking too prematurely

column1: 0.0 My mother will be 85 in a few days. My sister planned a surprise party knowing the day, hour and location would be very difficult for me to attend.
column2: 1.0 I hope you make it. Thats a big birthday.

column1: 0.0 It is day after tomorrow and I am still not certain I can work it out. Sometimes people are very inconsiderate.
column2: 1.0 That not good. Maybe she will understand if you just can't make it.

column1: 0.0 My cousin just called with the craziest story. She and her family are locked inside a cemetery.
column2: 1.0 Wow... That would be one of my worst fears. How did they even manage to do that?

column1: 0.0 They had gone to a fair and decided to stop on their way home and walk around. I guess her husband lost track of time. The worst thing is they haven't eaten anything since about noon.
column2: 1.0 Wow! Any way they can get out? Did they call someone?

column1: 0.0 You hope your teens make the right choices, but sometimes even the right choices feel wrong.  He is choosing to be away with friends and not at home much.  I believe this is healthy, but I can help but want something different.
column2: 1.0 I know it is hard to start letting go, but it gets easier with time.  Don't worry, you are not alone.

column1: 0.0 That's what my own mother says.  In fact, she said my dad had a harder time than she did when I called and said, "Hey, I'm staying the night at so and so's, be back tomorrow."  I guess I will survive!  Hopefully he will choose to spend time here as he hits his 20s!
column2: 1.0 Yeah, they always seem to come back!  You just have to love them from afar for  a while.

column1: 0.0 I witness a great sight. I saw a gas station attendant leave his post to pump gas for a lady who has a hard time getting around.
column2: 1.0 That's really sweet. We don't have gas station attendants here. But that's nice that they're that helpful.

column1: 0.0 The one I refer to is more like a cashier. He is supposed to stay in a little shack and collect money and turn the pumps on. The lady offered him a tip and he wouldn't take it.
column2: 1.0 Ohh, that makes sense. Yeah, then that's really nice of them! And really sweet of her to offer a tip. I guess there's good in the world after all.

column1: 0.0 I have been fortunate to live a good life but I found a lump in my neck.  Most people would get it checked out immediately.  I waited.  I was scared to get the news.
column2: 1.0 I would absolutely be scared too. Good news or bad, I would be a worried wreck beforehand. Have you gotten it checked out yet?

column1: 0.0 I finally went to an ENT doctor in May.  They biopsied it, and that was the most nerve-wracking five days I have ever waited.  It WAS good news, but still had to have removed.
column2: 1.0 I'm so glad to hear it was good news, though!

column1: 0.0 Even when life is tough and seems very unfair I have done my best to care for my family.
column2: 1.0 Thats great of you. Life is VERY unfair but we can go at any minute, so cherish those you love!

column1: 0.0 It can be difficult. But I learned early on retaliating helps nothing.
column2: 1.0 It doesn't help us no. But you must take care of yourself too- Take some time for yourself when being a caregiver ok!

column1: 0.0 I am off work for a month in the summer, but I today was my first day back, and it felt great to be back on a routine!
column2: 1.0 Coming back to work could be good after a break.

column1: 0.0 A month is a great break to "get away from the daily grind" but believe me, at the end of week one you think oh, I have all the time in the world, and you aren't as productive.
column2: 1.0 I understand

column1: 0.0 I still can't believe I did that. My power had been off and I didn't even realize it.
column2: 1.0 That isn't good.

column1: 0.0 I arrived at church just as everyone was leaving. Boy did I feel awkward
column2: 1.0 Did anyone help you?

column1: 0.0 When I was pregnant, I thought so much about what my son would make me feel!
column2: 1.0 I wish I could feel that feeling, (unfortunately, I am a man). What did you end up naming your son?

column1: 0.0 I named him George, men can have feelings of their sons too. Hopefully one day you will as well.
column2: 1.0 I am greatly looking towards starting a family with my wife as well. George is such a nice name.

column1: 0.0 Have you ever been hospitalized? It's not much fun. I had a mini stroke and was stuck there for a few days.
column2: 1.0 I have - but not for anything that severe. Are you suffering any side effects of the stroke?

column1: 0.0 I am 99% me  The hardest part of the hospitalization was at the end of the day when my last visitor would go home. I am not good at being alone.
column2: 1.0 Yup - I know that feeling. And it's always so hard falling asleep in those uncomfortable beds with an IV in your arm.

column1: 0.0 I have a full time job that doesn't pay anything.
column2: 1.0 That really sucks man. Are you planning on looking for a new one?

column1: 0.0 I love my job, it involves my five year old kid and my eighty year old grandma.
column2: 1.0 Well, as long as you're doing something you enjoy, that's all that really matters.

column1: 0.0 I have a table that is somewhat unsteady, I put my computer on there because I have no where else to put it.
column2: 1.0 Have you figured out what's the problem?

column1: 0.0 I have not, it seems to do ok except when my son puts his foot on there even though I tell him repeatedly not to do that!
column2: 1.0 Sounds like maybe one of the legs on the table is bent?

column1: 0.0 My 2 year old daughter keeps picking up random words lately.
column2: 1.0 Yes? thats so cute, but you have to be carefull not to say bad words in fron of them

column1: 0.0 I know!  She said the f word!
column2: 1.0 OMG, well it is a bad thing but now you can be more polite in front of them, and also when you are not with them!

column1: 0.0 I went to a concert last weekend and saved the tickets.
column2: 1.0 Are you keeping it as a souvenir?

column1: 0.0 I am, I plan to scrapbook it once I get the pictures back.
column2: 1.0 Nice, I do that sometimes with movie tickets if it's a great movie that I enjoed a lot.

column1: 0.0 We recently went camping.  Everyone definitely gets closer in such close quarters!
column2: 1.0 I've been camping a few times - the proximity to others makes me feel stuffy too. Where do you usually go?

column1: 0.0 We went by a lake.  I accidentally opened the bathroom door with someone in it!
column2: 1.0 Oh wow! I bet the person inside would've pooped his pants, but there was probably none left!

column1: 0.0 This Spring has really made me appreciate family.
column2: 1.0 What happened?? Did you guys went camping or something?

column1: 0.0 My grandmother fell ill, and passed away.
column2: 1.0 Ho, I am sorry to hear that.

column1: 0.0 I got a notification on my phone that I had a package delivered and went to look for it
column2: 1.0 Too late I already took it. Just kidding, did you find it?

column1: 0.0 I did, they left it sitting in the middle of the driveway so it could get run over!
column2: 1.0 Oh, that's bad. Was there anything important in it?

column1: 0.0 My son and wife are coming for a visit. Been a long time since I have seen them
column2: 1.0 Wao thats so cool you must so excited, how long has it been?

column1: 0.0 about a year. I am on the east coast and they moved out west
column2: 1.0 Wao it must be very difficult to be separated from your wife and son, sorry

column1: 0.0 I went to a hockey game with my five year old son earlier this year. I had to bring lots of supplies!
column2: 1.0 Oh yeah? Do you have to do that every game?

column1: 0.0 When I have my son with us I do! My husband was shocked when he said he wanted his blanket and I pulled one out of my purse!
column2: 1.0 Thats funny. Well at least it sounds like you are always prepared.

column1: 0.0 I have been married for ten years. Since we aren't swingers, I'm a one man kinda lady.
column2: 1.0 That's cool. I am not a swinger either.

column1: 0.0 Staying with the same guy day in and day out over a long period of time can be tough.
column2: 1.0 How did you do it?

column1: 0.0 After a full year of trying to get a leak fixed, I got help from a neighbor's roofer, who "knew a guy."  He said the guy didn't work on roofs, so I was confused!
column2: 1.0 That makes no sense.

column1: 0.0 Exactly!  The roofer told me that since I replaced my roof and the leak was still there, the problem had to be my fireplace chimney.  He said stone chimneys often develop leaks.  As it turns out, this chimney guy fabricates a type of gutter for chimneys to keep the water from running down the rock.  For $300 he made and installed the "gutter" on site, and I have had NO leaks!
column2: 1.0 That seems like a good price.

column1: 0.0 its so hot here. i've had to shower like 3-4 times a day cause you start sweating anyway and it feels icky. Hows the temperature at your place?
column2: 1.0 right now it's freezing in my home lol I just got out of bed after 30 mins of sitting because it's coold

column1: 0.0 what? where the hell do you live? what do you mean its freezing? oh my god i am so jealous
column2: 1.0 haha i live in virginia where right now the temperture outside is muggy 85 degress just regular ac pumping in my home

column1: 0.0 ooooh you have an AC, thats why. I live in europe and AC's...arent a thing at all, only the occasional pharmacy will have an AC
column2: 1.0 aw man that must suck how do you huys keep cool through the summer

column1: 0.0 Oops. I meant I was upset when my dog died.
column2: 1.0 I'm sorry, How long has it been?

column1: 0.0 Happened in Febuary.
column2: 1.0 That's always a tragedy.

column1: 0.0 Last week, my girlfriend invited me to meet her parents. The whole time I was on edge because I wanted to make a good impression.
column2: 1.0 That's nerve wracking for sure.  How did it go?

column1: 0.0 Well we had dinner and the whole time a was stuttering because her father was asking very personal questions, but I think they liked me.
column2: 1.0 It probably went well, despite the common jokes most parents want their child to date someone good so try to look for the best in people.

column1: 0.0 We love going on our annual family camping trip, and just got back from it!
column2: 1.0 Oh nice! How long did you guys stay?

column1: 0.0 We went for a week, but did have to come back to town once.
column2: 1.0 Oh no, What happened?

column1: 0.0 I really love being in the great outdoors with my family!
column2: 1.0 Oh yea? Where are you guys? In the mountains? Camping?

column1: 0.0 We went camping, yes.  We're in the Midwest, so no mountains, unfortunately.  But we were near a lake.
column2: 1.0 Lakes are awesome. A body of water around here is pretty far. How long are you guys staying?

column1: 0.0 I did well on a project for a company
column2: 1.0 Did you get anything extra, like a bonus or a trip.

column1: 0.0 I think I might get promoted based on the work
column2: 1.0 Great. What business is it?

column1: 0.0 I was on my way home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk
column2: 1.0 I can tell where this is going.

column1: 0.0 I got completely drenched, it was terrible
column2: 1.0 That has never happened to me. Thank god!

column1: 0.0 I am a stay at home mom. School just started.
column2: 1.0 Well does that make you anxious?

column1: 0.0 It does, this is my only child and he is going to kindergarten.
column2: 1.0 Oh, that would be rough. I've been through that too.

column1: 0.0 A close friend of mine has to leave the state for work
column2: 1.0 Are you happy for him?

column1: 0.0 Kind of, it's going to be sad since I won't see him again most likely
column2: 1.0 But if is a great opportunity for him, you should be happy.

column1: 0.0 A friend was able to fix a problem I was having
column2: 1.0 That's very nice of the friend. What sort of problem was it?

column1: 0.0 Computer problem.  It was something I couldn't figure out on my own
column2: 1.0 Bah, those newfangled computers. It's nice to have a tech saavy friend.

column1: 0.0 My coworkers sometimes put more work on me than necessary.
column2: 1.0 Why do you think they do that?

column1: 0.0 They don't want to talk on the phone and can get away with it for a while.
column2: 1.0 That's not fair and probably very frustrating for you. You need to say something to them.

column1: 0.0 I moved to tornado alley a few years ago. I'm not used to large tornadoes so I was pretty scared when it started storming.
column2: 1.0 Oh man, I can't even imagine. I lived in Kansas for a while and we had a storm that did a lot of damage. Took out the power all day and stuff. Nature can be so devastating sometimes.

column1: 0.0 We aren't too far south of Kansas in Oklahoma. We have had to spend a few evenings in the storm shelter. I guess stuff can be replaced.

column1: 0.0 I love it here, except for the tornadoes and snakes.

column1: 0.0 We went on the cruise in February. It was a Disney cruise in the Bahamas! What a great experience.
column2: 1.0 I've ALWAYS wanted to go on a Disney cruise - it's probably my dream vacation. I'm so jealous!!!

column1: 0.0 I was so glad when I graduated college
column2: 1.0 That's such a great accomplishment and such a relief at the same time. What was your major?

column1: 0.0 Communications. It was a little tough but not engineering tough!
column2: 1.0 I totally get that. I majored in business but sometimes I wish I majored in engineering. I'm kind of glad I didn't though. It's hard!

column1: 0.0 My family is so supportive. They even flew out when my last dog passed away and spent some time with me to make me feel better.
column2: 1.0 Aww, that is very nice of them. i just had to put mine down a few weeks ago.

column1: 0.0 I'm so sorry to hear that. What kind of breed was your dog?
column2: 1.0 Border Collie. Yours?

column1: 0.0 I was very scared when flying for the first time
column2: 1.0 I can imagine! Did you end up having a good flight?

column1: 0.0 I did. Luckily no turbulance!
column2: 1.0 That's good! Hopefully you had a nice seatmate too!

column1: 0.0 My son starts school soon, we had a fun day out but when we got home he was really bad.
column2: 1.0 Aww, was he scared?

column1: 0.0 I don't think so, I think he was just over the day and it was too much for him.
column2: 1.0 I can see that. School is a challenging time for a kid.

column1: 0.0 I was very ready going into my test
column2: 1.0 Always good to feel ready for something like that. What subject was it in?

column1: 0.0 Engingeering. It was really tough!
column2: 1.0 Man, I remember those days. My engineering exams were killer. Did you do well on it?

column1: 0.0 Anytime we take a trip, I normally save what some people consider trash.
column2: 1.0 Another man's trash is another man's treasure! What things do you save?

column1: 0.0 Just different things that I can scrapbook, mementos from my trip.
column2: 1.0 I keep a scrapbook myself! I love collecting stamps. Got any trips planned this year?

column1: 0.0 My pants feel down when riding my bike
column2: 1.0 I'm so sorry that happened to you. How did you handle this situation?

column1: 0.0 I just pulled them up. it was just embarassing.
column2: 1.0 I hope no one saw that, it must've been terrible.

column1: 0.0 I was scared to go to school
column2: 1.0 How are you going to learn! Why are you afraid to go?

column1: 0.0 Just nervous about all the people
column2: 1.0 It ain't so bad. I'm sure you'll make a few new friends and everything will be just fine.

column1: 0.0 I was scared of going into the caves
column2: 1.0 Please describe what scared you about the caves.

column1: 0.0 Just the darkness.
column2: 1.0 That seems like a valid reason to be scared of going into the caves!

column1: 0.0 We live in a very high cost of living area but don't make a ton of money.

column1: 0.0 I'm not sure, sometimes I wish I had what the other people around me had.
column2: 1.0 I do too but it's natural to get envious of others sometimes, don't put yourself down over it.

column1: 0.0 Sometimes people ask me to do a lot of other stuff when I already have a lot on my plate.
column2: 1.0 That must be so annoying. I get that sometimes too.

column1: 0.0 I feel like people don't care that I have stuff to do.
column2: 1.0 I'm sad to hear that, I'm sure there is someone who cars.

column1: 0.0 My son went to the best preschool. When I needed him to stay late, they always had space for him.

column1: 0.0 I hope so, it really helps to get your village when you have kids.
column2: 1.0 Yeah, my village helped with my son's preschool tuition as well. Strength in numbers and good neighbors!

column1: 0.0 At Fazolis. It was so gross.
column2: 1.0 During dinner? ACK!

column1: 0.0 hello
column2: 1.0 Can you tell me about your recent experience?

column2: 1.0 Yeah, I love Star Wars. I was sad when Han Solo died. He was my favorite character!

column1: 0.0 My husband went to go hang out with his guy friends leaving me all alone.

column1: 0.0 Yeah, I mean I didn't want to tell him he couldn't. I just don't like being by myself.
column2: 1.0 I know how you feel, I'm sorry about that, at least he probably came back pretty quickly.

column1: 0.0 I felt upset when I forgot to ask my friend to dinner.

column1: 0.0 That is true. Good way to look at things!
column2: 1.0 Where did you end up going?

column1: 0.0 Tomorrow's my last day of work. I can't believe it. I wish I had something lined up.

column1: 0.0 I have and tried negotiating with my old work. I have an interview next week with another company so I hope that goes well!

column1: 0.0 I was so mad when some guy cut me off in traffic!
column2: 1.0 Oh no. Did you flip him off?

column1: 0.0 No, I remained calm, but I was very mad!

column1: 0.0 i couldnt stand it when my neighbor was using power tools at 8 am on a saturday

column1: 0.0 nope, it was very frustrating, he lives next door too
column2: 1.0 Have you talked to him about it?

column1: 0.0 I'm pretty worried about what the future will hold. I lose my job tomorrow. Trying to keep my head up!
column2: 1.0 are you getting laid off?

column1: 0.0 Yes, unfortunately. We are having a huge company layoff and being a remote employee didn't help my case.
column2: 1.0 im sorry, i hope you're able to find an even better job immediately

column1: 0.0 I was really scared when Hurricane Irma came through Florida last year. It was a pretty horrible experience.
column2: 1.0 Do you live in Florida?

column1: 0.0 I do, in Orlando. I feel lucky to have had no damage to my home and been in a central location, but the storm was awful and we had no power for 4 days.
column2: 1.0 Wow, that sounds terrifying. You are very lucky to have made it out without any property damage though.

column1: 0.0 I work online to make extra money for things my family wants.
column2: 1.0 Thats amazing, you must be a good person

column1: 0.0 It's nice to be able to pay for fun things that our budget doesn't allow us to normally do.
column2: 1.0 How many kids do you have?

column1: 0.0 i felt bored being by myself all week

column1: 0.0 it was just boring because i had so much work to get done
column2: 1.0 Well at least you didn't have a lot of people under foot to slow you down. So I hope the sacrifice of being bored was worth it.

column1: 0.0 My son's school starts next week and they just changed the first day of school!
column2: 1.0 I am so sorry to hear that!

column1: 0.0 My husband had to ask off for a different day without much notice!

column1: 0.0 I was looking through my cloud and found some pics of when I was little.
column2: 1.0  A walk down memory lane.

column1: 0.0 Yeah, it makes me miss being at home and around my family.
column2: 1.0 Oh I bet! It's always good to cherish those memories.

column1: 0.0 I was watching my favorite tv show and my husband kept talking to me during it.
column2: 1.0 oh that can be annoying, did you tell him anything?

column1: 0.0 I just gave him a look. The thing is he says I do that instead of waiting til commercial, but then he goes and does it to me.

column1: 0.0 I was glad my dad asked me to go on a mission trip with him.

column1: 0.0 Belize. He did doctor stuff. I didn't do much. But it was cool to see what they were up to.
column2: 1.0 Oh, that is really cool! What a great experience, and fun to bond with your dad!

column1: 0.0 about an hour

column1: 0.0 My friends were finally coming over to visit, it had been a long time since I saw them last.

column1: 0.0 Yeah, I really miss seeing them since they moved.

column1: 0.0 i have good memories when i see photos of my grandmother

column1: 0.0 Well last week my husband and I celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary.
column2: 1.0 Congrats! I'm sure you will have great memories.

column1: 0.0 thats true.  Are you married yet yourself?
column2: 1.0 Yes I am married

column1: 0.0 I hope you are as happy as I am.  Its nots easy though, a work in progress, but worth it all in the long run.
column2: 1.0 I am happy and yes its a lot of work. Anything worth having takes work to keep it.

column1: 0.0 I have a presentation tonight, I'm nervous but I still think I'll ace it.

column1: 0.0 It was a wild tarantula. I had my family rush me to the hospital, but I ended up being just fine. It only caused me discomfort for a couple of days.

column1: 0.0 Great. We were just cracking jokes the whole time. It was good to see him.

column1: 0.0 A little worried. While super smart as we get older we gain real world experience in dealing with people that you can not learn in a book. But still at 20 I was struggling with my associates degree.

column2: 1.0 Same here. Well I hope he can adapt and do well. Good luck with your BA too!

column1: 0.0 Yea, I even called and let them know the highway was closed down and I was going to be late. I even text her photo of the traffic accident once I got up to it.

column1: 0.0 I didn't have any that day, I was also out of money

column1: 0.0 Yea, as I pulled over I thought it was someone down on his luck. Nope, he was crazy.

column1: 0.0 Well, after about an hour I got up to pee. As I washed my hands I looked up and my face was covered with sauce. It looked like someone poured it on my face,
column2: 1.0 Oh wow, the BBQ must be delicious.

column1: 0.0 Do you ever wake up and realize how lucky we are? I travel a lot and I just got back from Haiti. I'm convinced it's better to be poor in America then rich in Haiti.
column2: 1.0 That's a profound thought. We definitely take America for granted, especially when some people say it's in its "worst state in a long time." We're prisoners of the moment.

column1: 0.0 Those that criticize have not traveled the real world out side resort gates or into the third world. Then you see a real state that is in trouble.
column2: 1.0 Yeah, I guess you would know for sure, since you've seen it first hand. Especially a place like Haiti, that's just gets pounded with hurricanes. What brought you to Haiti, if you don't mind me asking?

column1: 0.0 Monday I was downtown for work. I was on my way home when a homeless man asked form some money. I went to reach for my wallet and it was gone.
column2: 1.0 I am sorry to hear that.Is there a chance you forgot your wallet home?

column1: 0.0 No it was stolen. So when I went to reach for it. The homeless man could tell something was wrong. He actually paid for my train ticket home. I end up seeing him again today. Took him out to lunch and gave him some money.

column1: 0.0 All I want in life this weekend is to sleep and I have to work.

column1: 0.0 When I was a kid, I remember telling my mom to take me to McDonald's, just so I could get the toy in my Happy Meal. I didn't even care about the food.

column1: 0.0 Unfortunately, I accidentally sent an email to a coworker essentially complaining about her attitude. I really wanted to dig myself in a hole and never come out.

column2: 1.0 I hear you. Maybe humor might help? Like "okay, so *this* is awkward....can we talk about that email?" Heartfelt apologies go a long way, and even if she doesn't respond -- you'll feel better for trying.

column2: 1.0 Time does fly really fast. I just turned 30 and it feels like I was just a teenager yesterday!

column1: 0.0 Yes it was. It only took a few short months and my father passed away due to it being inoperable.

column1: 0.0 Thanks! Graphic design mostly. At my old job I was a manager and it was horrible.
column2: 1.0 Sometimes being a manager is the worst job you can have at a place, you seem to be the one who gets blamed for everything.

column1: 0.0 Recently, I got passed over for a promotion at my job.
column2: 1.0 Aw man, that sucks. Promotions usually aren't given fairly in my experience. Was that the case for you too?

column1: 0.0 No, the guy that got it was qualified, it's just I really wanted the job. It would have really help my career.
column2: 1.0 I'll keep my fingers crossed for you that you get that promotion next time!

column1: 0.0 Haven't been paid for it yet, but people that visit are welcome to put in an offer for anything they see! Fingers crossed someone wants mine!

column1: 0.0 I was enjoying the morning watching the kids play in the pool.

column1: 0.0 As a child, I was mean to my sister all the time and I still feel awful about it.

column2: 1.0 Have you talked to her about it? Maybe she doesn't really think about it anymore.

column1: 0.0 he got my favorite flower, an orchid a card and made dinner

column1: 0.0 Went to get an oil change the other day. Turns out I didn't need one for another 1, 000 miles, and I felt like such a fool.
column2: 1.0 Well better to be sooner than later on something like that. Dont be hard on yourself.

column1: 0.0 Agreed, and it had been 5 months so I figured I was due. The mechanic was really condescending which was what made it embarrassing!
column2: 1.0 Thats so silly its none of his worry. He needs to hush up. lol

column2: 1.0 Wow! He sounds like a super smart cat! How did you get him out of there?

column1: 0.0 He is! Well, both smart and dumb haha. Had to use a knitting needle to pick the lock!
column2: 1.0 Well at least you managed to save him!

column1: 0.0 I've got a coworker with zero social skills, and it's driving me batty. She can't seem to tell no one wants to listen to her talk for 30 minutes straight.
column2: 1.0 Oh man, I've definitely had a few coworkers like that myself before. What does she even talk about?

column1: 0.0 If you make a comment on anything, say cats, she'll go into a monologue about everything she's ever learned about a cat (most of it wrong).
column2: 1.0 That's the worst! Some people, once they get started, they just can't stop themselves. It's like opening a can of Pringles.

column1: 0.0 We had an annoying client the other day, and I went to the breakroom to complain about her to my coworkers (thinking she couldn't hear).
column2: 1.0 Did it feel good to get it out?

column1: 0.0 It did at first, until I left the room and saw she was sitting right by the door where she could hear everything! It was humiliating and I felt really bad for her after that.
column2: 1.0 Oh no, that's awkward! Did you get in trouble for it?

column1: 0.0 I found some baby kittens in my yard, their mother was dead. I nursed them to health and found homes for them.
column2: 1.0 That's heartbreaking, but you're amazing for doing that. Cats are my favorite and I've rescued many animals. It's a lot of work.

column1: 0.0 They are my favorite, too. I love how independent they are.
column2: 1.0 Yes, and when they love you it feels special, because they don't love everyone like dogs do. You've racked up a lot of good karma for saving them!

column1: 0.0 I'm sorry we're both in this situation. It really sucks, and it feels unfair because it's not for lack of effort.
column2: 1.0 Yeah, that's right. I've been pushing 70 hours working a week for as long as I can remember. Hold out, maybe it'll change.

column1: 0.0 I was out of school for over a year and thought i forgot everything before taking this big test

column1: 0.0 I know it was nerve wrecking but studying all the time and i mean al the time paid off
column2: 1.0 Im glad it paid off for you, you must be super proud!

column2: 1.0 Oh no, I am so sorry. What did you do?

column1: 0.0 To be honest, I fell into a pretty deep depression. No one wanted to hire me. It was tough.
column2: 1.0 That is tough. That must have been quite the trying time. Did you eventually find work?

column1: 0.0 I'm SO ready for fall - it's been incredibly hot all summer, and I need my favorite season to hurry up & get here!
column2: 1.0 Oh yes, fall is definitely my favorite season as well! I love fall scents!

column1: 0.0 Me too! Wearing comfy sweaters, snuggling up with a hot drink, and fall smell on the air...can't wait for it!
column2: 1.0 It is the best season, by far! Plus, Halloween!

column1: 0.0 A bunch of fruit flies appeared in my apartment out of nowhere the other day. I think it's because of some old veggies in my fridge. Totally gross.
column2: 1.0 Oh man, those things are awful and reproduce like crazy.  We left our house for a week and came back to tons of them everywhere! The best trick is putting a little apple cider vinegar in a jar, a drop of dish soap on top of that and cover it with cling wrap and put holes in it.  They will gravitate toward it and you'll catch a bunch! Just keep changing it every few days.

column1: 0.0 Thanks for the tip, I will try that! I cleaned out the fridge and most of them seemed to just go away. I have no idea where they go but don't really care either as long as they're gone!
column2: 1.0 Seriously, gone is good.  They do have bacteria on them and lay their eggs on fruit and veggies and the larva burrow into the fruit or veggie so its good you trashed it all. Glad you're free of them!

column1: 0.0 I'm getting married next year! Hoping everything goes smoothly and we get the wedding we want to have.
column2: 1.0 That is so exciting! It can be stressful and expensive planning a wedding.

column1: 0.0 Boy are you right about that. I was really excited during the early planning stages, but it's been stressful ever since.
column2: 1.0 It really gets stressful when you get down to the last minute. You are always so worried you are going to forget something.

column1: 0.0 My friends went ahead and gave me a baby shower that I didn't know about.

column1: 0.0 Yeah, they had told my husband about it so he could get me there.

column1: 0.0 Thank you, me too! He's a little over 2 years old. I'd hate to lose him, but they usually don't live more than 2-3 years.
column2: 1.0 Oh I see, I can understand your concern. Perhaps he will live longer than most hamsters!

column1: 0.0 I went back to work for my former company recently. They laid me off a few years ago when things were tough. Coming back was a little scary but I was thrilled!

column1: 0.0 im upset that my neighbor's dog is sick

column2: 1.0 Well I certainly hope that the dog gets to feeling better. Are you close friends with this canine companion?

column1: 0.0 Well i had spent the good part of a week organising the best weekend away with my hubby for our 10th wedding anniversary. Spa day, great dinner, concert and of course the parents were booked to mind the kids for the weekend.  However all did not go to plan...
column2: 1.0 Oh no, what happened? Hopefully the whole weekend didn't get ruined!

column1: 0.0 Well unfortunately the day before we were due to go my little 2 year old daughter woke up covered in spots.  As the day went on more and more appeared and she had a roaring temperature.  We realised she had chickenpox.  She was feeling so miserable and of course all she wanted was her mummy and daddy.  It was a bit depressing and part of me was devastated but our weekend away was not to be.  Sure kids always come first dont they?!
column2: 1.0 Poor little thing, chicken pox are the worst. On the bright side, you still got to spend your anniversary with your husband, just not, you know, in the way you hoped. Hope you guys get to have a make-up weekend soon!

column1: 0.0 My neighbor has a brand new Tesla and every time I look at it I get so envious. I know it's stupid, I should be happy for him that he has such a cool car.
column2: 1.0 Wow thats nice.  What do you drive?

column1: 0.0 Well that's the thing, I don't. I bike everywhere. Don't get me wrong, I love my bike and it's a great way to stay fit.
column2: 1.0 You have to think of the positives.  Just because they have a new car doesnt mean their life is great.  They could be watching you wishing they were fit and healthy like you are.

column1: 0.0 That is a really good way to put it, I will definitely keep that in mind next time I find myself pining after his car.
column2: 1.0 lol and some day you might you buy your own new Tesla, if you feel like it!

column1: 0.0 A Tesla with a bike rack!
column2: 1.0 Exactly!

column1: 0.0 I'm happy my package just arrived
column2: 1.0 oh thats nice

column1: 0.0 im glad it came earlier
column2: 1.0 yea i would be to

column1: 0.0 I found some old keepsakes in the basement ealier

column1: 0.0 I've got a fun weekend coming up, and I'm really looking forward to it!

column1: 0.0 Going to the drive-in, out to eat, and probably minigolf. Nothing particularly special, just haven't had fun in awhile!

column1: 0.0 the rain today is frustrating

column1: 0.0 im not a fan of it at all
column2: 1.0 Yeah I know what you mean. I can't wait for the rainy season to end.

column1: 0.0 The other day I was riding my bike and this woman ran a stop sign, nearly hitting me. Thank goodness I was paying attention and was able to stop in time.
column2: 1.0 Oh my goodness, I've almost gotten hit while on a bike before and it's terrifying. I'm so glad you're alright!

column1: 0.0 I wish people would pay more attention. I try to do my best to follow the rules of the road both when I'm on my bike and in a car.
column2: 1.0 Ditto. It's not hard to do, and so many lives would be saved if people would just follow the rules. I'll send good vibes out so nothing bad happens to you in the future!

column1: 0.0 My boyfriend proposed to me, and I accepted! I thought he didn't want to get married so it was a welcome surprise.

column1: 0.0 Thank you! We're hoping to get married sometime next year, but man weddings are expensive. It may be further off than I'd like!
column2: 1.0 Oh I feel you, I used to work in the wedding industry. It's crazy how much it costs even for the most basic wedding.

column1: 0.0 I just had my birthday and I ate WAY too much. Had a good time, but boy do I feel bad for all of that food. I'm supposed to be eating healthier!

column1: 0.0 No kidding. Had free refills on a root beer float too, and how could I say no to that?

column1: 0.0 i am pleased with the day im having today

column1: 0.0 me too but we wouldnt appreciate the good days if it werent for the bad

column1: 0.0 Every night before bed, we read the Bible to our son. I love when he relates what he learned to real life.
column2: 1.0 That is really awesome! That is so important to be involved in his life like that.

column1: 0.0 It is. And shows that he is listening.
column2: 1.0 It does! Kids can understand things about the bible that most adults overlook.

column1: 0.0 Our mail carrier keeps leaving packages outside instead of putting them in the lobby.

column2: 1.0 that is unfortunate, im sorry that happened!

column1: 0.0 I can't wait for it to be Christmas already. Just thinking about that time of year makes me really happy.

column1: 0.0 Each day waking up I can't believe how lucky am I just to be alive.

column1: 0.0 Yes, I don't need anything. I have something to eat and a roof over my head. I really can't ask for anything more.
column2: 1.0 That's inspiring to me. I will try to think more like that as well whenever I get stressed in life.

column1: 0.0 I went running for the first time in months. I could not believe it. I was able to run a full 8 miles with out taking a break.
column2: 1.0 8 Miles!? That's very impressive.  I bet I could barely make it a mile!

column1: 0.0 Yes, my first time out in 60 days. I impressed my self.
column2: 1.0 Have you been a long time runner before that?

column1: 0.0 Just gave my wife access to my credit card. I'm worried but excited I can trust her. Do you ever have issues trusting people?
column2: 1.0 I can relate to that!  Yeah, my wife with my credit card, lol!

column1: 0.0 It's taken me 11 years to get to this point. Last time I let her have at it. She bought us a trip to mexico on my credit card.
column2: 1.0 Haha, I can understand the hesitation then.  But was the vacation at least worth the money?

column1: 0.0 "I've been at my current job 5 years. I'm at the point I can go into upper management but I'm afraid. Maybe I'm just comfortable now. I don't know.
column2: 1.0 That's something that takes a lot of contemplation, because it's such a big decision to make. Will the extra money be worth the extra work?

column1: 0.0 An extra 40k a year but it would be highly stressful. Currently I have the highest ratings in the USA, I'm sure any new employer would want me to bring them up to that stage as well.
column2: 1.0 Oh wow, an additional 40K is a lot! I'd be willing to put up with quite a bit for a pay increase that large.

column1: 0.0 I currently work 50 hours a week. I'd be working around 75-80 a week then.
column2: 1.0 Oh wow. I'll be honest and say it wouldn't be worth it for me! What's an extra 40K if you're never not at work to enjoy it?

column1: 0.0 I took my wife surfing for the first time today. within an hour she was riding waves, Color me impressed!
column2: 1.0 Oh wow, I think it'd take me much longer to not bust my butt! That is impressive!

column1: 0.0 Yes, I was surprised. I've been at it my entire life and never seen anyone pick it up so quickly. She is not even athletic.
column2: 1.0 Maybe she's more athletic than you think! She might be better than you soon. Better watch out!

column1: 0.0 I discovered my cat peed on my bath mat when I got out of the shower today and the mat was wet.
column2: 1.0 Oh no! That stinks. I've never had a cat specifically because I've never been good with the idea of being able to train them. Plus it seems like you just get the one personality, and they never grow to like you. But I'm biased.

column2: 1.0 Yeah, I know they definitely suit some people. I actually now technically have one... my roommate wanted to get one, and I felt too bad to say no. And he actually is a pretty nice guy, mostly because he's been affectionate from the start. So, we'll see how it goes! Sorry again about your mat.

column1: 0.0 We've had our dog for over 8 years. He past away this spring.
column2: 1.0 I'm so so sorry!  We lost our chihuahua in February, so I completely understand that feeling.  Was he sick prior to passing away or was it sudden?

column1: 0.0 It was sudden. He was completely fine when we went to bed. No issues at all. Its been hard for our daughter
column2: 1.0 I think it might actually be harder to watch our kids go through that kind of loss than to actually go through it ourselves.  Our pup was our daughter's dog and she was sick prior to passing, so we knew it was coming.  Still doesn't really help though.  We ended up adopting a pup from the shelter that had lost her human mom - it was meant to me - my daughter lost her pup and this pup had lost her mom.  It's helped, something to think about at least.
